gurmukhi: AwNKn Awgih TwF lgy sKI dyq nhI ikh hoq idKweI ]jw sMg kyl kry bn mY iqhqy Aiq hI jIX mY duicqweI ]
transliteration: Oonkhan Aagad(i) Thaadh Lage Sakhidet Nahikih Hot Dikhaaee|| Jaa San Kel Dare Ban Mai Tih-te At(i) Hijeeya Mai Douchitaaee||
translation: Krishna is always standing before my eyes, therefore I do not see anything else; they had been absorbed with him in amorous play, their dilemma is increasing now on remembering him;

gurmukhi: hyq qjXo biRjbwsn sO n sMdys pTXo jIX kY su iFTweI ]qwhI kI Er inhwrq hY ipKIXY nhI sXwm hhw morI mweI ]866]
transliteration: Het Tajyo Brijbaasan Sau Na Sandes Pathyo Jeeya Kai Su Dhithaaee|| Taahikior Nihaarat Hai Pikheeyai Nahisyaam Hahaa Morimaaee||866||
translation: He has forsaken the love of the residents of Braja and has become hard-hearted, because he has not sent any message; O my mother! we are seeing towards that Krishna, but he is not visible.866

gurmukhi: Pwgn mY sKI fwr gulwl sBY hir isau bn bIc rmY ]ipckwrn lY kir gwviq gIq sBY imil gÍwrn qaun smY ]
transliteration: Phaagad Mai Sakhidaar Gulaal Sabhai Har(i) Sio Ban Beech Ramai|| Pichkaaran Lai Kar(i) Gadvat(i) Geet Sabhai Mil(i) Gvaaran Taoun Samai||
translation: In the moth of Phalgun, the young damsels are roaming with Krishna in the forest, throwing dry colours on each other; taking the pumps in their hands, they are singing charming songs:

gurmukhi: Aiq suMdr kuMj glIn ky bIc ikDO mn ky kir dUr gmY ]Aru qXwg qmY sB Dwmn kI ieh suMdir sXwm kI mwn qmY ]867]
transliteration: At(i) Soundar Kounj Gadeen Ke Beech Kidhau Man Ke Kar(i) Door Gadai|| Ar(u) Tyaag Tamai Sabh Dhaamanndkieh Soundar(i) Syaam Kimaan Tamai||867||
translation: Removing the sorrows from their mind they are running in the alcoves and in the love of the beautiful Krishna, they have forgotten the decorum of their house.867.

gurmukhi: PUl sI gÍwrn PUl rhI pit rMgn ky Pun PUl lIey ]iek sXwm sINgwr su gwvq hY pun koklkw sm hoq jIey ]
transliteration: Phool Sigvaaran Phool Rahipattee Ranad Ke Phoun Phool Leee|| Ik Syaam Seegad Su Gadvat Hai Poun Kokalkaa Sam Hot Jeee||
translation: The gopis are blooming like flowers with the flowers attached to their garments; after bedecking themselves they are singing for Krishna like nightingale;

gurmukhi: irqu nwmih sXwm BXo sjnI iqh qy sB Cwf su swj dIey ]ipiK jw cqurwnn cauk rhY ijh dyKq hoq hulws hIey ]868]
transliteration: Ritu Naamah(i) Syaam Bhayo Sajnitih Te Sabh Chhaad Su Saaj Deee|| Pikh(i) Jaa Chaturaanan Chaouk Rahai Jih Dekhat Hot Hulaas Heee||868
translation: Now it is the spring season, therefore they have forsaken all the embellishment; seeing their glory even Brahma is wonder-struck.868.

gurmukhi: eyk smY rhY ikMsk Puil sKI qh paun bhY suKdweI ]Baur guMjwrq hY ieq qy auq qy murlI nMd lwl bjweI ]
transliteration: Ek Samai Rahai Kinsak Phul(i) Sakhitah Paoun Bahai Soukhdaaee|| Bhaur Gounjaarat Hai It Te Out Te Murlinand Laal Bajaaee||
translation: Once the flowers of palas were blooming and the comfort-giving wind was blowing; the black bees were humming here and there, Krishna had played on his flute;

gurmukhi: rIJ rihXo suin kY sur mMfl qw Cib ko brnXo nhI jweI ]qaun smY suKdwiek QI irq Aausr Xwih BeI duKdweI ]869]
transliteration: Reejh Rahiyo Soun(i) Kai Sur Mandal Taa Chhab(i) Ko Barnyo Nahijaaee|| Taoun Samai Soukhdaaik Thirit Aousar Yaah(i) Bhaidoukhdaaee||869||
translation: Hearing this flute the gods were getting pleased and the beauty of that spectacle is indescribable; at that time, that season was joy-giving, but now the same has become distressing.869.

gurmukhi: jyT smY sKI qIr ndI hm Kylq ic`q hulws bFweI ]cMdn so qn lIp sBY su gulwbih so DrnI iCrkweI ]
transliteration: Jeth Samai Sakhiteer Nadiham Khelat Chitt Hulaas Badhaaee|| Channdan So Tan Leep Sabhai Su Gulaabah(i) So Dharnichhirkaaee||
translation: In the month of Jeth, O friend! we used to be absorbed in amorous play on the bank of the river, being pleased in our mind; we plastered our bodies with sandal and sprinkled rose-water on the earth;

gurmukhi: lwie sugMD BlI kprXo pr qw kI pRBw brnI nhI jweI ]qOn smY suKdwiek QI ieh Aausr sXwm ibnw duKdweI ]870]
transliteration: Laae Sougaddh Bhalikapryo Par Taa Kiprabhaa Barninahijaaee|| Taoun Samai Soukhdaaik Thieh Aousar Syaam Binaa Doukhdaaee||870||
translation: We applied fragrance to our clothes and that glory is indescribable; that occasion was highly pleasing, but now the same occasion has become troublesome without Krishna.870.

gurmukhi: paun pRcMf clY ijh Aausr Aaur bGUln DUr aufweI ]DUp lgY ijh mws burI su lgY suKdwiek sIql jweI ]
transliteration: Paoun Prachanndd Chalai Jih Aousar Aur Baghoolan Dhoor Udaaee|| Dhoop Lagad Jih Maas Burisu Lagad Soukhdaaeek Seetal Jaaee||
translation: The time, when the wind blew ferociously, the cranes arose and the sunshine was agonizing, even that time appeared to us as joy-giving;
